title: How can we categorize human knowledge? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: How can we categorize human knowledge? A: One way is: Domains in culture. eg Here is a very very small sample of some example domains  And here’s the evolution of some domains of knowledge  Source: StoryAlity #149B – The Tree of Culture But see also this chapter in The Encyclopedia of Information Science & Technology: StoryAlity#144 – The structure of the meme, the unit of culture (Encyc of InfoSci & Tech 2017) And see also: StoryAlity#140 – The Evolution of the Systems Model of Creativity (Csikszentmihalyi 1988-) As for: And how is each category related to the other? That’s super-complex. Culture evolves just like Biology. So - take a look at how different species in biology are related (eg through a common ancestor.) Noting also that: Knowledge = Culture = Information. Here is another way to organize it Note: Maths is at the bottom (we’re probably living in a sim, see: Nick Bostrom) And without Geology (a place to be) and Physics and Chemistry you can’t have Biology (organic chemistry)… Once you have Biology you can have Psychology (eg living things have control centres, eg brains & nervous systems) and once you have those you have groups, and culture. etc  StoryAlity #100A – The 3 Universal Laws of Holon/Partons So one way to organize it is emergence. Like the diagram below. (Emergence goes upwards in the diagram)  Source: StoryAlity#143 – All of life is doing science

Knowledge is categorized by Type and Context. There are many knowledge types like: Questions, Answers, Stories, Procedures, Contradictions, True, False, Facts, Predictions, Nonsense, and more… Human beings store their knowledge in 10 Knowledge Contexts: Name, Authors, Purpose, Environment, Language, Configuration, Operation, Owners, Markets, and Values.
By dividing it first in 2 parts: Human needs. Works both on individual and group levels.The world around us.And then splitting each part into smaller pieces the way you find the most useful for you.
You can categorize and relate human knowledge any way you wish. Determine what you want to achieve with your system and proceed.
